intro: Bupleurum ranunculoides var. canalense, commonly known as the Canary Islands buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant features basal leaves that are palmately lobed and small, yellow flowers arranged in umbels. It thrives in rocky and coastal habitats, often growing in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its range.
